message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating an unknown parameter vector from sign measurements with a perturbed sensing matrix. This problem is closely related to the fields of information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), signal processing (cs.SP), numerical analysis (cs.NA), and statistical inference (cs.SI). The paper uses tools and techniques from these fields to analyze the performance of the maximum likelihood estimator and to formulate the estimation problem as a convex optimization problem. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IT, cs.LG, and cs.SP, followed by cs.NA and cs.SI.
